description: From Middle English depraven, from Old French depraver, from Latin dēprāvāre (“pervert, distort, corrupt”), from de- + pravus (“crooked, distorted, perverse, wicked”).

verbs.description: deprave (third-person singular simple present depraves, present participle depraving, simple past and past participle depraved)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To speak ill of; to depreciate; to malign; to revile
(transitive) To make bad or worse; to vitiate; to corrupt
